description.narrative: Directorate of Primary Education and its offices in the 20 convergence districts have capacities to increase students' learning achievement and survival rate to grade five

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Bangladesh: Evaluation of Gender in the UNICEF Bangladesh Country Programme 2017-2020
2019 Bangladesh: Formative Evaluation of Meena Communication Initiative
Bangladesh 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Bangladesh Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Directorate of Primary Education and its offices in the 20 convergence districts have capacities to increase students’ learning achievement and survival rate to grade five

description.narrative: Increasing students' learning achievement and survival rate to grade five | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Percentage of Upazilas that implement Upazila Primary Education Plans (UPEP) and School Level Improvement Plans (SLIPs)

target.value: 2016:10% for UPEP and 100% for SLIP by 2016

actual.value: 2016:100% for SLIP and 40% for UPEP as per ASPR 2016 based on the information of 2015.

title.narrative: Proportion of primary schools that have developed child centered development plans
c1a. Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2016:UNICEF supported to develop School and Classroom Based Assessment (SCBA) methods and tools on 12 subjects that were piloted, fined-tuned and incorporated in the national curriculum dissemination package.

title.narrative: Number of schools that implement Each Child Learns/Child Friendly School model interventions, which aim at improving learning competencies
